website_summaries.verdict: Interactive set of letters that uses your fridge or other magnetic surfaces to help kids ages 2 and up learn letter sounds.
pros: A fun and multi-sensory way to introduce little ones to letters while working on motor skills and coordination
Kids are able to manipulate the letter tiles and connect them to the yellow school bus
When pressed into the school bus kids hear Tad the tadpole say the letter's name and sound
Pressing it again will cause him to say a word that begins with that letter and use it in a sentence
The music note plays one of 3 learning songs
cons: Depending on the magnetic strength of the surface you connect it to, the tile and bus may slide down

customer_reviews.title: Wrong letter and sound for each piece
customer_reviews.text: The letters do not produce the right sound. The letter “a” sings “the D says..”none of them are right. Also the two volume setting produced two different letters for the same piece that’s in in bus part.
customer_reviews.author: Bridget L

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working; Horrible customer service
customer_reviews.text: This was neat until the sound just stopped working properly after three months of mild use. My husband has now been going back-and-forth with LeapFrog's customer service for 2 months trying to get a replacement. They told us we had to deface the product in order to complete an exchange. We wrote all over it with permanent marker and they said it isn't enough? Pathetic and obnoxious. If you order one, just hope that it doesn't stop working, otherwise, you are out of luck/money spent.
customer_reviews.author: DoctorMD17

customer_reviews.title: Great for learning!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my twin girls when they were 18 months old and had to put it away for a while because all it was being used for was being tossed acrossed the room, etc. I recently brought it back out because they are 26 months old now. They are actually learning from it and aside from my more destructive twin occasionally still throwing the letters, actually playing with it. I recommend it if you have a child over the age of 2!
customer_reviews.author: Kellie

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I’m knocking off a star, because I’m not sure if it’s just my fridge, but the big main piece keeps sliding down almost falling off the fridge. I put another sturdy magnet right at the bottom to keep it from falling, but besides that I love it! It sings a song every time he changes the letter and even sings other sings besides the alphabet, like wheels on the bus. Super cute! My son just turned 2, and loves to play with this toy, especially since he loves the fridge (always trying to sneak inside I mean)
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine

customer_reviews.title: Fun & Educational
customer_reviews.text: My 18 month old immediately started enjoying this as soon as I took it out of the package! It’s a lot bigger than what I visioned in my head. I initially bought it because her grandmother bought an expansion pack of lowercase letters. I got this because it has the capital letters. But the lowercase do not fit in it... I just assumed they’d fit in there because I don’t know what else they could go in. Nonetheless, we are very excited about this toy because she is obsessed with magnets right now. Fun & educational for her!
customer_reviews.author: Chasity S

customer_reviews.title: crucial learning made fun; love it!
customer_reviews.text: A great product for new parents. Makes really cool gift for a skower or a first birthday. Such a fun way for kids to learn phonics crucial for reading. The magnets stick to anything metal (but not stainless steel), as does the vehicle. Child puts a letter on the vehicle and it sings, naming the letter and it's sound: "The 'b' says buh, the 'b' says buh. Every letter makes a sound. The 'b' says buh!" For something that a parent will hear over and over, it's kind of cute, not really annoying. To REALLY get the most out of this, it should be accompanied with the DVD (or whatever medium) of Leap Frog's "The Letter Factory."
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun phonics!
customer_reviews.text: This toy is educational, fun, and toddler proof checks off all the boxes! Ours has been dropped many times on hard wood floors, down the stairs... both the letters individually and the bus base. Still works no problems or magnets coming apart which I was worried about at first. Catchy songs for letters, includes the classic “wheels on the bus” song as well! Can’t go wrong with a toy that teaches by melody babies love it!
customer_reviews.author: SAHM Teacher

customer_reviews.title: Not as durable as the previous version.
customer_reviews.text: I am not a fan of this newer version of the toy. It had it's first malfunction shortly after purchase, but I didn't think much of it since I put it up until my child got older. It has now been out for about a month and it's NEVER worked consistently. It plays the songs from the song button, but rarely do the letters get recognized without blowing it out or smacking it around. I have a friend with the older one. Its survived 2 children, 3 dogs and 4 years of daycare for kids under 5. Either I got a lemon or the technology got less durable.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Jensen

customer_reviews.title: One of our most used toys
customer_reviews.text: We set this up on the dishwasher in hopes of keeping our little one busy while we prepare meals and do our evening routine. It was a winner immediately. I recommend not putting out all the letters at once depending on the age of your child. Great clarity of letters and pronunciations. The two songs are very catchy and our little one was singing along in no time. The only thing i wish, that there were more songs.
customer_reviews.author: Val

customer_reviews.title: Cute sturdy toy
customer_reviews.text: Cute toy for the fridge. My son is only 18 months and loves to throw the letters and the toy actually and it's held up great! So we have it high up on the fridge for now and use it every once in a while with him. He does have a little bit of a hard time fitting the letters in but that will get better as he gets older. This is a very cute toy, probably best for ages 2 and older but that's okay, it seems it will be around for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Blakely

customer_reviews.title: Great learning tool
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THIS. My brother had one at his house and it helped his kids learn the alphabet and sounds of letters (I am NOT a teacher so if this thing will teach em it’s worth it). Catchy tunes that help the kids remember the sounds. My 2&3 yr old love it. 3 yr old can identify 1/2 of the letter after having it for a cpl weeks. Has been dropped/thrown onto tile kitchen floor a few times and it’s doing great.
customer_reviews.author: Shelley Bunn

customer_reviews.title: Educational and fun!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son's 2nd birthday. My friend has one for her daughter who is a year older and every time we visited this was his go to toy! He would press the buttons to dance to the songs then clap with excitement when he puts the letters in and it says the letter. My friend told me it basicly helped her daughter learn her ABCs so I knew this was a must when my son's birthday came! Needless to say he was so happy to come home to his very own! Keeps him entertained while I do dishes. It's educational and fun! You cant go wrong with this!
customer_reviews.author: N. Collins

customer_reviews.title: Missing pieces
customer_reviews.text: looks like it would be a great toy. We were sent duplicates of several letters and were missing several others. Package was hard to get into and had to tear it apart only to find out we were missing pieces... Now I have nothing left to return it in. Disappointed my daughter won't be able to use it as we had hoped.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: We love it!
customer_reviews.text: We’ve had for about a month now. I bought it for my daughters 1 year birthday. She LOVES it. We have not had any problems stated in other reviews, it sticks nice and strong to the fridge door, it registers the correct letters placed into the bus, all the letters were in the set. It’s pretty durable, too. She takes it all around the house just to hear it sing it’s two main songs (the alphabet song and the wheels on the bus song). I still haven’t figured out how she gets it to count, but somehow my one year old gets it to sing a 1-10 song as well. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mallory ONeal

customer_reviews.title: Clever, good space saver, toddlers love it
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. The song is catchy and my DS loves it when I sing along. I'm not sure if itnis actually teaching him anything since he's only 14 months (but I think we may have had some success with the counting version of this). It's a really neat toy that sings a song to demonstrate the sound each letter makes, and gives an example of a word that starts with it and uses it in a sentence. I also likes that it takes up little space since it lives on the fridge. Even though English isn't a truly phonetic language, this is a clever toy and seems to be good for many ages.
customer_reviews.author: LaceyTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: This is a must have for every toddler.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my daughter recommended it after my 4th grandchild was born. Three more grandchildren since then, and every one of them has loved this toy. They play with it EVERY time they come over, from when they start walking through Kindergarten. It is the perfect gift for a baby shower or a first birthday party. This is the best $20 I've ever spent.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Collins

customer_reviews.title: Hours of distraction and fun
customer_reviews.text: Oh my goodness I could have never predicted just how wonderful this toy is. Not only does it keep my into-everything, all over the place, high energy 1 year old entertained for a significant amount of time... it also kept my 3 year old and 10 month old nieces entertained just as much when they were visiting. They loved playing the songs and switching out the letters. The dancing and laughing from playing with this toy was just too cute. It’s going to be one of my go-to gifts for little ones!
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: Does not make appropriate letter sounds
customer_reviews.text: This particular version is way off on some of the sounds the letters supposedly make. 'Z' says mmm?, 'L' says waaa??... The kids love it but I would like it to make the proper sounds for every letter and not teach incorrect. I had one for my now 16 year old when he was a kid. I wish I could get that same one because it was great. This one leaves some things to be desired.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda U.

customer_reviews.title: Great for many ages...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for My 18 month old Nephew. He loves it. As soon as he comes over he runs to the fridge and slides it off and runs around the house playing with it. He knows how to turn it on, distinguish that he has to touch the button to play it and knows the letters go in. Even his 8 year old sister loves to play it. I previously had an earlier version of the green one that I purchased for My niece that lasted well over 10 years. Kids of all ages loved that one as well. I love these products and My family does too.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best educational toy ever!
customer_reviews.text: This has to be the best educational toy ever. This not only teaches the kids alphabets and phonics but also makes the educational activity a fun time effort for the little ones. Every kid that has been to our house, can't stop playing with this toy. The volume control on it is a lifesaver as well since you don't want to hear that loud music all day long. Get this toy, and your kids will know the letters and phonics in no time.
customer_reviews.author: Shivangi

customer_reviews.title: Darn.
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed that it's missing so many letters. Read the reviews and just hoped that the one I bought wasnt missing any because my daughter REALLY wanted this for her birthday. Threw away the packaging and just not going to deal with digging in the trash and returning.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Proven FUN learning the alphabet as early as you want.
customer_reviews.text: I've used this with my 1st and last child. We bought a new one for each and there's nothing better than hearing your 2-3 year old screaming the alphabet and telling me what each letter sound makes. This simple device will prepare your child for the basics of preschool and kindergarten. Personally I homeschool so I start teaching these things early. This is fun learning and we need more of that! If your baby can press an easy button they will love this! Start early parents! It even has 2 sound levels for quieter learning. Just do a daily or weekly check to make sure the letters haven't fallen under the fridge or end up in the toy box.
customer_reviews.author: Mr & Mrs Bartalone

customer_reviews.title: Grandson loves this thing!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my grandson when he was only about a year old. Put it on the refrigerator, and he plays with it every day. Letters can go here and there, but not only is it a great toy, at 18 months he knows almost all the letter sounds! You can point at a letter and he will say the sound. Great learning toy,.
customer_reviews.author: L. McManus

customer_reviews.title: Very durable & kids love it.
customer_reviews.text: My kids love this learning toy. I am CONSTANTLY putting it back on the fridge and heating it played with. I have 5 kids ages 5,4,3,2 & 1. No joke they ALL play with this thing. It gets slammed around the house also... and fought over. I have never had any problems with it not working. Would buy again and I think it would make a perfect gift for any 654321 year old.
customer_reviews.author: Tesla

customer_reviews.title: Plays his favorite Songs!
customer_reviews.text: Toddler loves this toy! He especially loves that it sings his favorite 2 songs: "the wheels on the bus" AND the "ABCs." Of course, sometimes he will take all the pieces and throw them all over the kitchen, with the help of his older brother. However, as a mom, I think it has a lot of educational value and it's priced just right. Most importantly, you can lower the volume (although he's already figured out how to play with the volume buttons). I definitely recommend this toy to other moms of toddlers.
customer_reviews.author: Jean S.

customer_reviews.title: Fun, engaging and independent learning
customer_reviews.text: Great product. A nice independent learning activity for my three year old. When it came in the mail you could hear it in the box. This was extra exciting. My LO wasn’t expecting a toy and he knew it was for him based on what he heard. The bus is engaging and fun. The bus states the letter, the sound it makes and words that begin with that letter. We put ours on an old baking sheet so it can easily be moved from room to room. I encourage my LO to repeat the name of the letter and use his f Get to trace the letter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a great addition to his playroom that's going to make learning ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these magnets to go along with a magnet board I made for my son's 2nd birthday. Placing a letter into the bus plays a catchy little phonics song (the same song from the letter factory if you're familiar with that DVD). The bus also has a music button that plays the ABC song and Wheels On the Bus, both of which my toddler loves shaking his hips to. I've attached a photo of this magnet set on an oil drip pan I purchased from Walmart for $9. This is a great addition to his playroom that's going to make learning ABC's a lot of fun!
customer_reviews.author: AshleyTop Contributor: Children's Books

customer_reviews.title: It doesn’t work for long! Don’t buy!
customer_reviews.text: We have had it for less than 4 months and she’s used it 5 or so times because the letters stopped working. Y-says the “N” sound and another letter did that as well All of the other letters make a dinging sound indicating it’s not compatible or working...ONLY 5/6 letters work now and I have no idea why..it’s really cute and informative and I love leap frog, but if you only get a few uses out of this product, it’s useless so BEWARE. I even tried changing the battery with hope that it would rectify the issue, but it did not.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Williams

customer_reviews.title: If you expect children to hear the phonics clearly this ain’t the right product
customer_reviews.text: My kids love this thing - and it help to distract them away from opening their freezer draw because they see a toy and start playing- I will say the phonics on it make it hard to understand sometimes what they are saying- as an adult I find it hard to make out the sounds and letters so I can’t see it being a very good learning tool for my kids but it’s a cute concept.
customer_reviews.author: Breanna Lentsch

customer_reviews.title: Great quality toy for learning.
customer_reviews.text: We love this toy. It's really cute and sings cute songs. It really does help my kids learn. We owned the old version from 10 years ago and eventually lost many letters. Since you can't buy the letters separately, we just bought this new one. I'm glad we did. The only thing is that the picture is misleading, because it shows a lower-case "b". There are no lower-case letters with this toy, only capital letters.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Toy!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for my son'd 2nd birthday and he loves going to the fridge while I'm in the kitchen cooking and playing with his letters. They can get messy so we normally only put 3 or 4 letter within his reach. I also think that if we focus on a few letters at a time it won't overwhelm him with all the different songs and words. He espically love when it sings "wheels on the bus".
customer_reviews.author: JackieSudduth

customer_reviews.title: Must Have!
customer_reviews.text: My 16 month old daughter loves this toy. She is learning to place the letter piece in the correct (and gets frustrated like toddlers do), but it doesn't deter her from going back and using the toy over again. I'll catch her dancing & singing to the songs for the letters along with a quick rendition of "Wheels on the bus" and "ABC". I'm glad I got her this toy.
customer_reviews.author: Ginnie

customer_reviews.title: Good learning device and durable for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this! It’s been a hit for months now. She loves dancing to the songs and putting the letters in. Only wish it had more songs. Also wish that once it starts singing it can’t change because it’s so annoying to hear BBbbb over and over when she keeps pushing the button.
customer_reviews.author: HBD

customer_reviews.title: Defected toy from Amazon.
customer_reviews.text: I bought for my grandson birthday. He was unable to play with it. It did not work. We put in new batteries and it still did not work. We put in new batteries,again. It did not work. It did not have the vowel letter A. Baby sad. How can this happen? I trusted Amazon. Fails to stick tightly to the fridge. It rolls down to the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Paloma

customer_reviews.title: Perfect educational tool that makes learning fun!
customer_reviews.text: This has not only been very educational but also a lot of fun for both of my little ones! We bought this to help our oldest with her letters and sounds. It has been very helpful! I can't stress enough how glad we are that we bought it! When you press the letter into that slot on the bus, it says the letter, and the sound, and sings a simple little song about the letter and the sound. Press it again and it gives you a little sentence with the letter. Great educational tool that makes learning fun!! My kids love this! It has held up great with no issues! Well worth the buy!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Overall great, sturdy interactive toy
customer_reviews.text: Great & sturdy toy, to use on & off the fridge. Gave only 4 stars because one letter ( the letter “U” has the magnet insert missing and would not stick to the fridge) - aside from that my daughter loves this interactive toy. My daughter is only 7 months , yet loves use to use it with her- she especially enjoys the letter songs!
customer_reviews.author: Sandy L.

customer_reviews.title: It is easy for my son to get the letters in and ...
customer_reviews.text: This letter set is ok. It is easy for my son to get the letters in and out of the bus and change them out quickly. I have one complaint. The letters are mumbled when the toys speaks them. So B sounds like D and X sounds like S. My son is just learning his letter sounds and I am having to correct him on the letters this toy mumbles. Very disappointing. But it is fun when we are learning them together, but I don't let him play with it by himself, as I dont want him to learn the mumbled letters.
customer_reviews.author: Demon

customer_reviews.title: Cute and entertaining
customer_reviews.text: Plays 2 songs - ABCs and The Wheels on the Bus. Each letter plays a quick song about the sound the letter makes when pressed. If pressed again a word starting with that letter is said alone and in a sentence. It's very cute. The magnets are strong. The letters are a good size for little hands. The only issue is the sound quality because it's hard to really hear the sounds. But for the price it's good.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica A.

customer_reviews.title: Great educational product!
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. We bought it for our 8 month old who is just discovering fridge magnets. I love that this sounds out each letter, but you can also just play music using the little music note button. The only con (and reason I give 4 stars) is that my 8 month old is able to easily pull it off the fridge because the magnet seems fairly week. But, she has also dropped it on the floor many times and it has not malfunctioned so I guess that is good!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Where are the numbers?
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing... to a degree... the programing is there for it to do counting from 1 to 10 but leapfrog didn't make any numbers for this one. We ended up buying and older version on eBay that has both letters and numbers. Why leapfrog has stopped supporting this product is beyond my understanding but that is what I was told by their corporate office when I called to see if I could buy a set of numbers for this. I recommend that you get one with letters and numbers... the phonics is first rate by the way... even teaches the different sounds made by letter C which most sources miss totally.
customer_reviews.author: Pawl

customer_reviews.title: I like the older version much better
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product because it has additional features (i.e., plays the Wheels on the Bus song, says a word that starts with the letter, and uses that word in a sentence) that the previous version did not have. I like the older version much better, because the volume is a louder and the letters are bigger (and thus easier for little hands to pick up, hold, and insert into the toy). The only reason I am keeping this product is because it says a word that starts with each letter and uses it in a sentence--which is an excellent feature, even if the volume is much lower than the original.
customer_reviews.author: Southern_Housewife

customer_reviews.title: Toddler loves it!
customer_reviews.text: We've had an older version of the Leap Frog magnets for a while, but it didn't work anymore. Our 19 month old LOVES this new magnet. His favorite songs are Wheels on the Bus and the alphabet song, so he plays with this constantly. It was a great Christmas present!
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Meppelink

customer_reviews.title: MUST get for your toddler!
customer_reviews.text: My 1 year old had become interested in our fridge magnets so I wanted to buy ones for him that he could actually play with. He's a chewer of everything, so it had to be durable. Several moms recommended this product to me and we LOVE it!!! It is the cutest concept, the parts are a durable plastic so I don't have to worry about him biting pieces off. He quickly learned how to put the letters in the school bus and dances to the songs. Fantastic gift for any toddler!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for my toddler
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old daughter loves the alphabet and she already can identify all of the letters, but I figured this would be a great next step for her and good practice. She really enjoys this toy. Each letter has its own little magnet to place into the bus. The bus will then sing a little song about what sound the letter that's in it, makes. It will also sing "Wheels on the Bus" and the alphabet song by pushing the little music button. It's durable and a lot of fun for my daughter. I also like that it goes right onto the fridge, so she can play while I'm cooking. I would recommend this for any toddler.
customer_reviews.author: JennaTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: This toy teaches effectively
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is 2 and knows that B is for Backpack, X is for X-ray Fish, etc... We occasionally move it to the top of the fridge so we can get a break from the obnoxious sounds, but those same obnoxious sounds are effectively teaching my daughter phonics. I really appreciate that this toy indicates all the sounds a letter might make (with a few exceptions). For example, "C says kuh and ssss". Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Pixel Artist

customer_reviews.title: BUY
customer_reviews.text: Using to homeschool kindergarten. GREAT to buy. Very durable and the letters we spell words with as they are also use phonics part. My two year old can NOT break these! These should be a part of every home. My 3 love EVERY aspect of these!
customer_reviews.author: shawnda jarvis

customer_reviews.title: Awesome letters toy
customer_reviews.text: This is such a fun and educational toy. I love that the letters are bigger in size to not pose a choking hazard. I also like that the volume has two setttings. It works well on my stainless steel fridge but I have friends that didn't realize their fridges were not magnet friendly due to the thick stainless panels. Some stainless steel fridges will work with magnets but check first to make sure. Otherwise I'd buy a magnetic board for it.
customer_reviews.author: april marie

customer_reviews.title: MY CHILDREN, and NOW GRANDCHILDREN
customer_reviews.text: I bought this when my now 18 year old was three, it helped him so much he was reading before he turned four. It is strong that the magnets dont give or break and really magnetic hold. Now, with the grandchildren I have purchased. Great, basic, amazing learning tool. Now if they would bring back the three letter word maker I would be so happy. For that was also amazing fridge mate as well.
customer_reviews.author: Alise

customer_reviews.title: Mamas! listen to make sure it's saying the right letter!
customer_reviews.text: My toddler loves it and has literally learned letters from playing with it. BUT we don't want them to learn the wrong letters, do we?!!!! Totally says the wrong letter about 1/2 the time after about a year of use. Also H HORN sounds like a different word, you can't hear the N. lol. I'm buying a new one after I leave this review in hopes that the new one will last for a while before it starts teaching incorrect letters.
customer_reviews.author: LH

customer_reviews.title: Hooray for another Fridge Magnet!
customer_reviews.text: I got a total of 3 of these for my preschool grandchildren so they can learn the letters of the alphabet & the sounds of each. I think it's wonderful that Leap Frog has decided to make another Fridge Magnet available after discontinuing that product line. The Farm Animal version I bought at least 6 years ago is still on my fridge & has provided entertainment & learning opportunities for 7 of my grandchildren. I anticipate this new one focusing on letters of the alphabet will be just as durable & loved as a toy as well as being educational.
customer_reviews.author: PKS

customer_reviews.title: Great, inexpensive and educational toy
customer_reviews.text: This toy is great for teaching the ABCs and their sounds. You put each letter magnet into the bus (which is also magnetic) and it sings the song from the "Leapfrog Letter Factory" video. In case you haven't seen the video (which I also recommend), it goes: "The A says 'ah,' the A says 'ah,' every letter makes a sound the A says 'ah'" The only reason I took off a star is because some of the sounds are hard for a child to pick out, and the song is slightly changed from the video. This makes it harder to remember when you go back and forth between the two.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Dagnillo

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after my 1 year old enjoyed so much at a friend’s house. Then whenever another baby comes, they love to play with it and heard other moms say “i guess we need to buy one of these too.” It is great foe babies and toddler who enjoys music
customer_reviews.author: yaykan

customer_reviews.title: Great toy!
customer_reviews.text: This is our second one of these, the first went to several of my nieces and is till in use. This one is helping to get our four year old kindergarten ready, and is a great toy for rooms that have doors.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle r

customer_reviews.title: Highly Suggested Buy
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for our 11 mo. old niece who loves to play with magnets! The songs and magnetic letters keep her engaged and safely satisfies her fascination with magnets while she learns. Win win all around LOL Everything came is described, and I love that the volume can be adjusted and we can shut the whole thing off when she’s not here.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Baby Toy!
customer_reviews.text: We bought one of these for our first son, glad that it is still available 5 years later for our second child. It's a wonderful learning tool - we made a large steel backed picture frame and hung it low on the wall. It's one of his favorite things to play with in his room now - he dances to the music and while he's not talking yet, he is definitely listening to all the letter sounds! Delivery was quick and easy.
customer_reviews.author: Whitney Maybee

customer_reviews.title: Educational and entertaining
customer_reviews.text: Adorable! This toy is awesome, it's educational and fun. My son loves the music and it kept him busy while I was in the kitchen cooking. I would have given it 10 stars when we first got it, the four stars is because it left scratches on our brand new stainless steel fridge:-/ (it looked like there was a tiny rough plastic piece on the back, it may have just been on ours) we still love this phonics bus, however it's no longer on our refrigerator, it's on a magnetic board in our kids playroom. I would still recommend this toy, just check it out before you put it on stainless steel.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: So cute and useful!
customer_reviews.text: I love it, my toddler loves it, it's so handy. The only problem is I wish you could switch modes so that it would say the sentences options first instead of the sound option. I feel like my toddler rarely hears the example sentences because he rarely pushes the second time except by accident. But it's so cute, my almost 3 year old has an easier time using these (magnets aren't too strong or weak, they're easy to put in the slot properly, the push reaction and buttons are easy to use).
customer_reviews.author: Tawn

customer_reviews.title: the older model is much higher quality and in my opinion it was better. The frog is now a sticker instead of ...
customer_reviews.text: My little girl loves this educational toy, however, the older model is much higher quality and in my opinion it was better. The frog is now a sticker instead of made of plastic, AND more importantly the new version sings the alphabet song MUCH faster. The older version Alphabet song was slower and more rhythmic, in fact my nephew learned his entire alphabet shortly after playing with the older version. If I had a choice, I would've chosen the old version. It can often be found on ebay or garage sales in case anyone is interested in the older version.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Best educational gift for littles I have found!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived before expected. This product is probably the single best learning tool for little ones. I just gifted this particular item to a friend for her daughter's first birthday and I have gifted this item to several other kiddos. My own son had the three letter word version gifted to him for his first birthday. Within months he was forming three letter words and was mastering the alphabet. At one year old! This is basically my go to gift at this point. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Rchowd

customer_reviews.title: Maybe for older kids 4+
customer_reviews.text: Great concept but in the individual songs ("b says ba, b says ba" etc) the mechanical sound makes it hard to differentiate between a lot of letters. For example: "B" sounds like "D", "P", "E", "G", "C", etc. if the child presses the letter a second time, the unit used the letter in a word, so that's helpful. I guess just the fact that it's a fuzzy recording makes it tricky to really differentiate. Not sure if it could be "fixed". The toy in itself is a good idea though. I probably wouldn't buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Ec42882

customer_reviews.title: Awesome learning toy
customer_reviews.text: Awesome for learning Abc My two year old loves this toy! I was gifted one of these, then purchased an extra one because my son lost some letters around the house. Letters also stick to refrigerator. Great learning tool!
customer_reviews.author: ,Brandi Timmons

customer_reviews.title: The only toy I've bought twice after losing pieces for the first one
customer_reviews.text: This is the only toy I've bought twice. Our first loved it and it taught him his letters. Over the years, we have lost enough letters that we need to buy another one for our second, who is already clearly intrigued with it. I have no problem getting another one (although I do wish they would sell packs of just letters/numbers - and would be great if they were interchangeable). This is an awesome purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Farmlady

customer_reviews.title: Educational and sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: This a great device. My daughter is only one and she is already playing with it. She has thrown it a couple times. Still is holding up. Great buy and the letters stay on the refrigerator.
customer_reviews.author: Mamicandy

customer_reviews.title: and I really like how it says a word that the letter starts ...
customer_reviews.text: We are working with my 2 yr old son on learning his letters and he is loving this magnet set. He really likes to say the annoucican of the letters and repears what sound each letter makes. and I really like how it says a word that the letter starts with and then uses it in a sentence. Plus it's an easy distraction for him to stay out of my cabinets while I am trying to cook!
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Rector

customer_reviews.title: It's really loud, be advised
customer_reviews.text: Even on the lowest volume setting this thing is L O U D. The songs get repetitive and it's all the same tune. BUT hey it's phonics and my kid loves placing the magnets in the slot.
customer_reviews.author: Jane N.

customer_reviews.title: Good educational toy
customer_reviews.text: The best educational toy. A very good start to teach alphabets and their phonics to kids. My daughter loves taking out and putting the alphabets from the base. Pros: 1. Easy to educate kids 2. A fun educational toy to play with 3. Easy to carry around, even in a diaper bag 4. Can also be used to teach small words like cow, cat, etc Cons: Nothing to mention. Would have been better if it plays more rhymes or atleast the wheels on the bus rhyme completely.
customer_reviews.author: srv

customer_reviews.title: Great educational toy
customer_reviews.text: Super cute toy to teach your little one letters. Our just turned 2 year old has just started learning his letters, so I thought I'd give this gadget a try. When you place each letter in the bus it says the letter name, the sounds it makes, and then usually an example etc. The bus also sings "The Wheels on the Bus" and "ABC" song. There are 2 volume levels available. My son plays with this toy, although he is not exactly infatuated with it or anything. I am happy with my purchase as I know it's an educational tool that my son will learn from.
customer_reviews.author: mommyof3

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for 18 months and older
customer_reviews.text: Love this toy. My daughter will play at fridge while I cook dinner for 20 mins or more and at time. There are 2 volumn settings which are awesome. The letters fit in the counting leap frog fridge magnet too but don't work fyi. The only down fall is magnets will be all over your house and floors. Beware.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki R.

customer_reviews.title: Great learning toy!!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this! Speech therapist recommended this for my son. Love that it sticks right to the fridge so it’ll keep him busy if I’m trying to cook. He loves school buses so this was a perfect one to grab; they do have other styles. Great price too! He’s learning and doesn’t even know it!
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: DONT HESITATE!!! BUY IT.
customer_reviews.text: Best $$$$ I've spent on learning stuff for my daughter yet and shes almost now. She still uses it daily. Has every piece too lol. I would highly recommend it. I even got my niece one.
customer_reviews.author: BeautifulDisaster 941💜💜💜💜💜

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: This was suggested to me for my 2 year old who has been very interested in learning his letters and although he knew almost all of them, this helped push him the rest of the way. Its very simple for him to use and he really enjoys the little songs and changing out the letters. This should be promoted more because it is awesome for little ones!!
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: My son loves this and is learning a lot. (This version calls "Z" "ZED")
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this toy and on top of teaching him myself his alphabet, he is learning a lot from this toy. My only irritation is that this is apparently the European version that calls the letter "Z" "ZED" instead of "Zee". I popped the back off to see if this was a regional setting I could change and you cannot. You will just have to YELL over the "ZED" parts. Haha!
customer_reviews.author: HAL Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: Gave this as a gift this weekend. When the child opened it was missing the letters ABC. Very embarrassing. Unfortunately I ordered this in the beginning of May. I would suggest opening it immediately if there are letters that might be missing. Will never order LeapFrog products online again.
customer_reviews.author: Donna R.

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome learning toy
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome learning toy. My 16 month old plays with it and jiggles to it. He likes taking the letters out and trying to fit them back in. I only took out A,B,C and D for now. No need to overwhelm with all the letters. They will just be all over the place anyway. But in a few months I’ll take more out. I think the phonetics way of teaching through the toy is great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lame
customer_reviews.text: My hope for this toy was that it would go on the fridge and entertain my daughter. She played with it for maybe ten minutes and then we were both bored of it. Not all of the letters even make the right sounds. The "Z" doesn't sound like "z" and the "B" & "D" are almost interchangeable. The music button is a joke. Two songs. Two. The "ABC" song which my daughter already knows and "Wheels on the Bus" which we sing better together without the toy. Wish I hadn't wasted $15 on this.
customer_reviews.author: Mia Mason

customer_reviews.title: Classic.
customer_reviews.text: I love this toy! It's a classic. I don't think it's actually going to teach my son and letters or sounds, but it'll keep him busy while I'm trying to cook dinner.
customer_reviews.author: Erica Lee

customer_reviews.title: Must have!!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome learning toy!! My son received this as a gift a few years ago and it was instrumental in him learning his letters and sounds. He learned the ABC song to the leap frog tune MUCH earlier than "regular" twinkle twinkle tune. Whenever we would talk about a letter, he'd run over to the fridge and find that letter and play its song. I purchased this new version (newer bus style and letters are a smidge smaller) for my 2 year old nephew. He is already well on his way to learning his letters too! This is my #1 go-to gift for 2-3 year olds.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: definitely would buy again, infacted I did!!
customer_reviews.text: Had this with my 1st born and loved it so much baught it again for my 3rd and last. My 2yr olds loves to play with the letters and pressing for the songs to come on. Very happy over all
customer_reviews.author: lizzy0356

customer_reviews.title: Educational toys are the best in my personal opinion
customer_reviews.text: Educational toys are the best in my personal opinion. I love that it repeats its self, and it gives both the letters and letter sounds. It's programmed with two songs my LO's favorite is the wheels on the bus... I find that both small and big kids get a kick of the magnet letters... they are study and bulky enough to not go under the fridge and get lost.
customer_reviews.author: Marli

customer_reviews.title: Poor sound quality
customer_reviews.text: Gave these as presents and were disappointed and embarrassed to find out that the quality of sound is not as it used to be in the same product that was bought about 5-6 years ago. If these were not given as presents definitely would have returned them. For a toy that promotes sound recognition and phonics- sound quality is of an essence.
customer_reviews.author: viktoriya moshura

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: My kids love leapfrog products. This magnet set keeps them busy while I'm in the kitchen. Two small complaints: 1. the magnet on the bus is not strong enough on our fridge so I have to put another magnet at the bottom to support the weight of it. 2. All the letters on display clutter the fridge so to keep a cleaner look, I'll store some letters on top of ours and rotate them every 2 weeks or so. My 1 1/2 year has learned many letter sounds because of this toy.
customer_reviews.author: Roselli

customer_reviews.title: Quality isn't the same as it used to be
customer_reviews.text: The quality isn't what it used to be. I bought these for my son for his birthday as I did witj my other 3 children. I received and opened the package to day. As we were putting all the letters on the fridge, unfortunately we found one letter 'R' is not magnetic.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Guiberson

customer_reviews.title: A perfect learning tool
customer_reviews.text: A perfect learning tool for my Godson who is three years old. He will learn his alphabets fairly quickly. I purchased this about 16 years ago for my first child. The magnetic alphabets are very strong and the bus magnetic is very strong it never fell off of the fridge. My godson loves it.
customer_reviews.author: MOM OF  3Top Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: Cute Fridge Toy
customer_reviews.text: My 20 month old will go the the refrigerator and push the button to make the music start playing, then will dance along. She occasionally tries to switch out the letters, but mainly just listens to the music at this stage. My oldest daughter (6 years) arranges the letters on the fridge in the ABC order and is always searching for the ones I have accidentally kicked underneath the stove when they get left on the floor ;). I have had this product for quite a while and loved that my oldest could fit a letter in and hear its name when she was learning her letters.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Booth

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! Exactly what I was looking for and more!
customer_reviews.text: My 2 yr old loves this and so do I! We purchased a Melissa and Doug wooden kit from Target that had numbers and letters but they got lost too easy under the fridge. It took no time at all before we were missing half the letters. Also, the paper they used on top of the wood began to peel off. I was so happy to stumble on this because the letters are much bigger and the phonics are a major bonus! I bought one for my nieces first birthday! Would highly recommend over the basic magnet letters and the wooden ones!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon user

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Super cute learning magnets. For either your fridge or other magnetic surfaces. My kids have so much fun with them and the price is great. Durable and shipped in a timely fashion.
customer_reviews.author: Julius

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. the idea is good to give the kids something educational to do while I'm in the kitchen. My 18mos old only had it a couple days before she was saying the letters and sounds. But be prepared to look for them all over the kitchen. My daughter likes to walk around with them and leaves them in various places. Not bad though if you have a baby gate. I always found them all sweeping the kitchen in the evenings.
customer_reviews.author: Momma E

customer_reviews.title: My kids and every other toddler that comes over is obsessed with this toy!!!
customer_reviews.text: My kids and every other toddler that comes over is obsessed with this toy!!! My two year old knows most of her letters and sounds because of this toy!!! The sound that teaches the sounds of the letters is very catchy and we sing it regularly.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Magnets should be stronger for a leapfrog toy
customer_reviews.text: Half the magnets won't stick to the fridge. But otherwise works fine. Some words are awkward for a child to relate to the letters instead of the basics they learn in school.
customer_reviews.author: BRI.G

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic learning tool
customer_reviews.text: I seen this at a friends house and I thought it was the cutest thing.. I bought 1 for my daughter and then 3 more after that! A total of 4 all together, I highly recommend this item! Could they have chosen some easier words here and there, like d - driver, yes, it should of been more simple and a clearer d word like "dog" but it's going with the idea/theme of it being a school bus magnet toy. But the songs are cute and makes it fun and I find that every child loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Fun activities
customer_reviews.text: We got a piece of metal from our local home improvement store and screwed it into the wall at toddler height. About 2ftx2ft and he has plenty of space to play with these and some other magnets. Great independent play to learn letters, sing songs and simple magnet fun. The magnet letters are very very light, but are a decent size so they are easy for little hands to hold. Also fun to spell words or names. Easily add in other magnet letters, small pieces of paper with hand written letters, or use with a magnetic whiteboard to add drawings or other letters.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my Nephew. He is a strong guys and it stands up to the occasional throw in the floor. He loves that it talks. He is starting to say the letters and bring them to my sister. She tells him to go put the B back and he’ll grab it and put it back. He is about 16 months.
customer_reviews.author: The Esh

customer_reviews.title: Best Fridge magnets!
customer_reviews.text: Got it for my 1 year old. Best fridge magnets ever! My 6 year old plays with it too! Magnets hold great and they stick out about 2 inches so easy for little hands to grab and no worries about the magnet piece falling off cause they are built inside of each letter. Great songs.
customer_reviews.author: kimberly d melville

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for kids just learning.
customer_reviews.text: Both my kids love this. They always want to be in the kitchen when I'm in their working, so I thought this could help make it more educational. I like that this sings about what sounds letters make. Alsobit has a volume button so it doesn't have to be blaring at me!
customer_reviews.author: Ashely Cramer

customer_reviews.title: My daughter loves this!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this bus! She loves to press the buttons on it and will carry it all over the house. I like the fact it teaches letter sounds and words that begin with each letter. I'm in the kitchen often which gives her the best access to the leap frog phonics set. Helps me to cook and her learn letters as I work on one letter at a time with her
customer_reviews.author: Live, love, laugh 🖖Top Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Great educational toy!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great educational toy for toddlers. I bought this for my 2 year old who already knows the alphabet, but this has helped a lot in teaching her phonics, she now says the sounds of the letters as well. I would definitely recommend this as a purchase, it's fun and interactive, and is great for toddler intellectual development. (It also helps keep them entertained while mommy or daddy gets some chores done in the kitchen ;).
customer_reviews.author: Nisha

customer_reviews.title: Great Learning Tool
customer_reviews.text: My son (18 mo) now says almost the whole ABCs!!!! He loves his alphabet bus. Literally the best purchase I’ve made, as far as learning toys go. We do only give him 4 letters a week, he’s a toddler.....he throws things. Very VERY satisfied with this purchase!!
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: My 3 year old loves it
customer_reviews.text: Very cute! My 3 year old loves it. The sound is not obnoxiously loud like many other toys, so I don't want to smash it in a million pieces after the 100th round of what the letter R says. We have had this for about 6 months now and haven't even lost a letter yet, so that can attest to the magnetic ability. It sticks pretty firm to the fridge or dishwasher surface.I have purchased 2 others as gifts and the kids have all enjoyed it. Would recommend for all!
customer_reviews.author: C Hyatt

customer_reviews.title: Leap Frog Magnets aids in Reading.
customer_reviews.text: I used these magnets in my PreK classroom. The students loved trying to match their letters, say the letters with Leap Frog and use the letter magnets to place them in Alphabetical order. I have used these magnets for 2 years in my classroom of 22 kids. It is very durable. It also helped students learn their letters at a faster pace.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Williams

customer_reviews.title: Best choice for letter magnets!!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this! Searched forever for fridge alphabet magnets and glad I went with this one. It's well worth the slightly higher cost compared to the really basic letter magnets. The letters stick out so are easy for little hands to grab. The magnet strength is perfect. Easy for kids to pull off, but strong enough to stay on without falling. I love that when you place the letter in the school bus, it says the name of the letter and the sound it makes. If you press the music note button, it plays ABC's or Wheels on the Bus. My daughter loves to dance along! Great entertainment and keeps her busy while I'm working in the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: MrsJ

product_meta.title: LeapFrog Fridge Phonics Magnetic Letter Set, Yellow
product_meta.description: The Fridge Phonics Magnetic Letter Set brings phonics skills to life with 26 singing, talking letters. Perfect for keeping little ones busy learning, the magnetic school bus and letter tiles stick to your fridge or any magnetic surface. Children can place each letter into the bus window and press it to hear Tad say the letter's name and sound. Press it twice and Tad will say a word that begins with the letter and then use the word in a sentence. Children can also press the music note to move and sing along to three learning songs, including the "Alphabet Song" and "Wheels on the Bus." Designed by LeapFrog experts for children ages 2 and older, Fridge Phonics reinforces alphabet knowledge, including letter names and sounds, which is an important first step in learning to read. Playing with the letter tiles, which are designed for easy manipulation by little hands, also helps strengthen fine motor and coordination skills.
feature_bullets: Play with 26 interactive alphabet tiles! Sing along to fun learning songs and explore the world of A to Z with colorful letter tiles that talk, sing and teach about the alphabet.
Includes Magnetic Tile Reader, and 26 Interactive Magnetic Tiles. Skills learned include phonics, the alphabet, fine motor skills, and vocabulary.
Celebrate A to Z with fun learning songs, including the "Alphabet Song" and "Wheels on the Bus. " Kids can learn the alphabet by placing individual magnetic letter tiles on the bus window.
Build vocabulary by pressing any letter twice to hear Tad use it in a word and a sentence. Place any letter on the bus and press it once to hear Tad say the letter’s name and sound.

Fridge Phonics reinforces alphabet knowledge, including letter names and sounds, which is an important first step in learning to read. Playing with the letter tiles, which are designed for easy manipulation by little hands, also helps strengthen fine motor and coordination skills.
